channel.title: Home on Kale Stahl's Personal Website
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Kale Stahl's Personal Website

item.title: Research
item.description: I am currently supported with funding as an NSF Graduate Research Fellow. My current research involves numerical methods for shape reconstruction in inverse scattering problems. In an inverse scattering problem, waves are scattered from an object, and the incident wave \(u^{in}\) and resulting wave \(u^{sc}\) are measured, with no a priori information about the scattering object. It is the goal of my work to use the information about the incident and scattered wave to determine characteristics about the unknown object.

item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description: Click here to see my current CV. For a list of my recent publications and other writings, see here. For a list of talks and presentations, see here.

item.title: About
item.description: I am originally from Topeka, KS and am currently a senior finishing my undergraduate degree in Mathematics and Physics at Kansas State University in Manhattan, KS. I will be pursuing my Ph.D. in mathematics at Purdue University this fall. After my Ph.D., my goal is to be a professor at a university and teach and conduct research full time. My current research interests lie within applied anlaysis and PDE, and I am particularly fond of mathematical application to physics, especially within wave equations.

item.title: Math Adjacent Stuff
item.description: Spreadsheets Here you’ll find a bunch of spreadsheets and spreasheet templates for various things: video games, tests, physics labs, Pokemon Cards, and so much more. Code Snippets that Aren’t Cool Enough for Github For things that don’t work well as spreadsheets, I make poorlyncoded python applications to serve their purpose. Here you’ll find code that isn’t good enough to be on my Github profile, primarily for my own archival reasons.

item.title: Publications and Papers
item.description: Publications in Referreed Journals D.L. Nguyen, K. Stahl, and T. Truong. A new sampling indicator function for stable imaging of periodic scattering media in Inverse Problems, Volume 39, Number 6, May 9, 2023. Link: https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1361-6420/acce5f/meta arXiv: https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.01206 Expository Works Undergraduate Honors Thesis: “Additional Proofs to Kirsch and Grinberg’s ‘The Factorization Method for Inverse Problems’” [pdf] Lecture Notes Lecture Notes on Sobolev Inequalities [pdf] Lecture Notes on Bipolar Green’s Functions (in progress)
